meanings.definition: Of or relating to limits or boundaries.
meanings.sent1: The limitary fence marked the edge of the property.
meanings.sent2: The map had clear limitary lines showing where one country ended and another began.
meanings.sent3: The limitary rules of the game made it challenging but fair for all players.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity knew no limitary bounds, reaching beyond what others thought possible.
meanings.sent5: The limitary nature of the law ensured everyone followed the same rules.

meanings.definition: Serving to set limits or boundaries.
meanings.sent1: The limitary policy helped control the company's spending.
meanings.sent2: The limitary measures prevented overcrowding in the park.
meanings.sent3: The limitary sign reminded visitors to stay within the designated area.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as a limitary force, guiding the team towards success.
meanings.sent5: The limitary nature of the contract protected both parties from overstepping boundaries.

meanings.sent1: The limitary regulations restricted the use of certain chemicals.
meanings.sent2: The limitary budget forced the department to prioritize essential projects.
meanings.sent3: The limitary diet plan made it challenging to indulge in favorite treats.
meanings.sent4: Her parents' rules felt too limitary, stifling her desire for freedom.
meanings.sent5: The limitary nature of the agreement ensured fair treatment for all involved.
